We are thrilled to introduce an exciting addition to the Elevation Tasting. Starting on September 2nd, a vertical of three vintages of our highly regarded RISE will be included in your tasting, complemented by our leading white blend, Intention. Chef Tim will also present a set of distinctive culinary bites to celebrate the release of our 2019 RISE blend.

Celebrate the final days of summer with something bubbly. Like summer, our Brut Ros√© is a crowd pleaser with a delicate finish. Primary notes of strawberry and raspberry, leading to orange zest, white clover, and peach. The lively bubbles complement its bright texture for a perfectly balanced, lighter-bodied sparkling wine.
Shop with the link in our bio and enjoy! ‚ú®

The 2021 Ros√© trio of dreams. ‚Å†üç∑‚ú®

‚ú®Ros√©: Strawberries, white peaches, and red grapefruit drive the aromas of this wine, but no single note demands the spotlight. Instead, they all operate in harmony, bringing a feeling of poise and completeness.‚Å† 
‚Å†
‚ú®Young Wine Pink: This wine smells of raspberries and cream. The texture is juicy, and rounder than most ‚Äúwhite wine‚Äù styled ros√©s, but a bit of effervescence leftover from the fermentation keeps it lifted and clean.‚Å†

‚ú®Quaker Run Ros√©: The aromas of this ros√© take you directly to the deeper, darker red flavors of ripe strawberries and black cherries elevated with clementine and white clover. ‚Å†

Happy 3rd work anniversary, Kristen! 

Kristen joined Early Mountain in August of 2019 and has been a leading asset to our culinary department ever since. Promoted to Sous Chef in early September of 2020, she has been instrumental in upholding the standards put in place by Executive Chef Tim Moore. In addition to contributing in myriad ways to Early Mountain's culinary program, Kristen loves a good brunch, beach week with her family, and playing with her dog Ryder.

We are lucky to have her on the team and look forward to many more years to come! üç∑

We are so grateful for Ben Jordan's talent and ingenuity during the seven vintages he led our winemaking team at Early Mountain. During his tenure, Early Mountain wines gained national recognition with his thoughtful, expressive winemaking setting a new standard. We wish him well as he departs Early Mountain to focus on a new project in the Shenandoah Valley. Since its founding, Early Mountain has celebrated and supported the continued growth of the Virginia wine industry, and we are proud Ben takes this same ethos to his new venture. The baton has been officially passed to our Lead Winemaker Maya Hood White. Join us in raising a glass to Ben!‚Å†

Toast the Twilight at Early Mountain! ‚Å†
‚Å†What could be better than summer sunsets in the Meadow? Beginning July 1st, we will be open from 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. every Friday for the month of July. The Meadow menu, as well as the walk-up bar, will be available into the evening for a casual summertime Early Mountain experience. Chef Tim will also be serving his famous fried chicken and other special accompanying dishes all day. ‚Å†üç∑
